Build: I20071101-0010

1) Installed Eclipse SDK + userui + releng.tools into a profile
2) From the self-hosting UI, selected releng.tools, and clicked "Uninstall".
3) In the dialog prompting to confirm uninstall, I unchecked releng.tools in the list, and then clicked Uninstall.

-> Error occurs:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Operands must not be null.
at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine.Engine.perform(Engine.java:38)
at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.operations.ProvisioningUtil.performProvisioningPlan(ProvisioningUtil.java:283)
at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.operations.ProfileModificationOperation.doExecute(ProfileModificationOperation.java:58)
at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.operations.ProvisioningOperation.execute(ProvisioningOperation.java:41)
at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.ProvisioningOperationRunner$ProvisioningJob.run(ProvisioningOperationRunner.java:48)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
This is more likely something that I should be catching ahead of time.
This could likely be caught at your level, however I think it should also be handled at the core level for API users. It is also necessary to understand why this happens.

I looked through the code, and this is already fixed. The problem was that the ProvisioningPlan(IStatus) constructor left the operand array as null. It now creates an empty operand array if there is nothing to do. The engine correctly handles an empty operand array by doing nothing. It's correct for the engine to be asserting it is not passed null input parameters.
